p: Multimodel inference identified different environmental drivers of E. coli and TSS by season ( Fig 3B and 3C). In the wet season, minimum temperature unlagged, river height unlagged, and rainfall unlagged were the most important predictors of E. coli concentrations. All 3 variables had statistically significant positive associations with E. coli ( Fig 3B.2). Rainfall lagged 4 weeks was the only important predictor of E. coli in the dry season and had a positive coefficient ( Fig 3B.1). Rainfall in the dry season, however, was an uncommon event.
